title: Experimental Methodology
description: Introduction to basic instrumentation and experimental methodology used in mechanical engineering, including calibration, use, precision and accuracy. Consideration errors, precision and accuracy in experimental measurements and technical reports.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: (ME 3340 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or CEE 3040 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D) and COE 3001 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and (ME 3015 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or ME 3017 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or AE 3515 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D) and ME 3345 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and (MATH 3770 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 3670 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or ISYE 3770 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or CEE 3770 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D)
